name: Cucumber Raita (Indian Yogurt Condiment)
description: Raita is a yogurt-based condiment that can be as simple as yogurt seasoned with spice, or it can have a variety of vegetables, fruit, or even chickpea fritters (called boondi) stirred into it. This is the most classic version; it includes crisp cucumbers and is gently spiced with a touch of chaat masala.
recipeIngredient: One 1-inch piece fresh ginger, peeled and grated finely (about 6g)
3/4 teaspoon kala namak (Himalayan black salt); see note
1 cup coarsely grated unpeeled cucumber (4 ounces; 120g)
1/4 cup (15g) chopped fresh cilantro leaves and tender stems

recipeInstructions.text: In a medium bowl, using a flexible rubber spatula, stir together yogurt, Thai green chili, ginger, chaat masala, sugar, and black salt. Fold in grated cucumber and cilantro. Serve right away or store in the refrigerator for 3 to 5 days.
